61904804
>>61904743

Either that, or this is the most bullish buy signal ever, I'm completely wrong and it's about to skyrocket into insane levels.

Whichever scenario, silver stackers don't lose, granted in one of them stackers don't materialize the short term gains they were anticipating from the incoming inventory crisis.

61904831
>>61904656
So where are the cheapies brah? I aint seeing no cheapies

61904836
fuck fuck fuck please don't let this kill the firm

61905350
>>61904743

Cheap silver is great for acooooomulation that is why me and others don't care if the price crashes because that doesn't crash industrial use, etc. But I'm also in crypto for the get money fast part

item.title: I just want to explore what this world has to offer... — 7 replies — 28.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
I just want to explore what this world has to offer...

Open thread • Replies: 7 • Updated: 2026-02-26 13:48 UTC

OP

I want to see new places, meet new people, and experience new things. The only problem is that I'm a fucking broke 27 year old NEET!!! How the fuck can I turn my life around in the age of AI? I have a degree in Microbiology, but I have forgotten everything. I have no connections from college as well. Is it over for me or can I save this sinking ship?

Early replies (first 3)

61904024
>>61904020
Have you tried going out and doing things

61904035
>>61904020
Be a homeless vagabond

61904038
>>61904024
It costs money to go out and do things. I do live in a city, so there are lots of things to do- but transportation costs money. Maybe I can beg my Dad to buy me a bike or something.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61904042
>>61904038
Just a helpless little baby aren't you

61904045
>>61904042
I guess I could get a job.

61905378
>>61904020
>i have forgotten everything
good. Nothing they ever teach you at jewniversities is useful, you learn things as you work irl. Don't be afraid to screw things up. Just send some CV to whatever entities are in need of microbiologists. There is nothing to see out there anyways, nothing of worth retarded faggots all around the world can tell you in different languages but...doing some travellings is the kind of thing you need to do so you can say "meh, it's not worth it"

61905382
>>61904024
Go out and do…what exactly?

item.title: BTC vs BCH vs BSV — 10 replies — 27.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
BTC vs BCH vs BSV

Open thread • Replies: 10 • Updated: 2026-02-26 13:29 UTC

OP

What would Satoshi say?

Early replies (first 3)

61903745
>>61903725
bitcoin cash is the original bitcoin

61903754
>>61903725
Satoshi would say: “this is how the Jew make money, and make a fortune. Let the goyim deal in the real world”

61903755
>>61903725
VISA, MASTERCARD, AMERICAN EXPRESS. Bitshit not needed

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61903756
>>61903725
Who cars what Satoshi would say? It it's up to the nodes.
Big blocks don't solve shit btw.

61903832
>>61903755

You know that you can send Bitcoin wallet to wallet, right?

People who don't know what they're talking about should stfu.

protip: if you knew what you were talking about, you would own Bitcoin.

61904133
>>61903755
>Bitshit not needed
Yes, the arguments around how to scale Bitcoin and then not delivering a functional solution is what caused this.

Hence we have BTC, BCH and BSV.

Scaled however, it could become cheaper than VISA and etc. That would be a turning point.

61905310
>>61904133
>could
BSV (Bitcoin) never really hits a scale ceiling.

61905351
>>61903725
BTC isn't a chain, it's a network. The other two are chains. Think of Bitcoin like tape drives. BTC cannot be a tape drive because there are gaps in the chain aka not a chain.

61905355
>>61903755
>now take a fee for every transaction from the goyim, they won't even notice

61905358
>>61905351
The "tape drive" model aka blockchain is what makes it possible to be decentralized. The network model is centralized, what everyone already had with paypal, banks, etc.

item.title: Massive Debt - Can I make something from nothing? — 5 replies — 20.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
Massive Debt - Can I make something from nothing?

Open thread • Replies: 5 • Updated: 2026-02-26 13:44 UTC

OP

I feel shame posting about this for the second time but the debt that's weighing on me is painful and besides being on a minus I've come to the point of having no money for food today... last time I posted about my situation was approximately 2 months ago and a kind user actually offered around 3k to me for free... which is crazy - but I wish I took him up on that kind gesture now.

If I sign up on XTB with no capital is there any way I could make something in the next 2-3 hours? I would greatly appreciate any advice... as for direct help - I don't expect it, but if that anon somehow stumbles upon this post again... that kind gesture would literally be a life saver now.

PS: If it means anything to anyone, I aspire to be a filmmaker, I used to weigh 140kg but I lost literally half of that weight and live a minimalistic life, hence why the debt I've accumulated hurts all the more. I'll leave my e-mail in case anyone wants to get in touch personally: sketchycornerofficial@gmail.com

Early replies (first 3)

61904902
>>61904888
>I've come to the point of having no money for food today
Are you stupid? Bankruptcy exists precisely to stop this from happening. Make use of it you idiot, you got nothing to lose.

61904912
>>61904902
You're wrong for calling me an idiot with no deeper context... I'm In Poland and the help I tried to get got me nowhere.

61904918
>>61904912
>I'm In Poland
You have similar protections regarding debt and bankruptcy as anywhere else in the EU.
Also you can literally move between 20+ different countries to get a job.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61904928
>>61904918
You're right about that but my situation is very particular... anyway, I'm sure I could borrow like 20zł from someone to survive for today but I'm so stressed about the 2k that I literally need to pay off today that I can't even imagine myself eating.

61905379
>>61904888
>Can I make something from nothing
No. You need money to make money.

item.title: There are people on this site right now posting about XRP and don’t even know this. — 23 replies — 24.4/hr
item.content:encoded:
There are people on this site right now posting about XRP and don’t even know this.

Open thread • Replies: 23 • Updated: 2026-02-26 12:55 UTC

OP

There are people on this site right now posting about XRP and don’t even know this.

Early replies (first 3)

61904404
>>61904399
price? and chart?

61904416
>>61904404
I can spoonfeed but I’m not giving a baby a dummy.

61904469
Well biz? You have researched the next Sol right?

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61904494
>>61904469
I’m not sure I’m seeing it anon.

61904499
XRP can literally execute trillions of tps using interledger (limited only by hardware engineering), capable of micropayment batching. TPS is not the hard limit win condition you think it is and literally any network can achieve absurdly high tps if willing to sacrifice security, decentralization, compliance, any shred of programmability etc. Just ask Nano, which catastrophically failed leading to all the operators abandoning it and the founders and team opportunistically using the moment to exit scam with the exchange that blocked withdrawal or sale while both publicly messaged that everything was fine and dumped. Solana is also on there and it had multiple total crashes within a few months and when the big hack happened, clawed back the assets, which is great for specific holders but meaningless to non-whales and evidence of extreme centralization. ICP is a ghost chain. ALGO is great and will probably thrive in a niche RWA but lost major opportunity because it focused on brand deals and events while solana focused on literally washing and faking volume and juicing pump and dump meme volume that builds and means nothing, to sell it to institutions and governments showing them the fake adoption and volume. ALGO through sheerly superior tech should have a substantial share of what solana has, particularly the Ondo inclusion, but had poor marketing. If they marketed better and if the market in general and those apprising it weren't so given to fake and gay activity it would be doing well and the world would do better through its success than sol's with actual decentralization thriving.

61904504
>>61904494
Chain inspect doesn’t lie. It’s early so ofc it doesn’t have huge vol…yet. TPS isn’t even the biggest story if Keeta. Eric Schmidt is an investor, it anchors to tradfi. Banks are coming. Keeta also literaly bought a bank. KYC on chain. Partnered with Google and rumors of VISA even. 120m mc. Already listed on CB and Kraken.

61904510
>>61904499
I bought XRP at literally .001 You aren’t early. Enjoy a 2x I guess. Keeta will do what XRP couldn’t. This board is a Reddit XRP psyop. Clearly it’s so the devs can extract from retail plebs. I’m actually helping you.

61904549
>>61904510
I bought XRP early also. Keeta can't do anything, has none of the compliance features institutions require which XRP has at a protocol level, has no liquidity, no built institutional rails or infrastructure level companies (like a fucking prime dealer) geared to specifically drive its adoption as optimally as possible with its parent company owning a majority of its corporate treasury in the asset. Keeta has nothing but a testnet tps count that again literally any shitty network could accomplish easily if that was all they cared about. Why has no single other network on the chart chosen to do this? It's not like Keeta is a breakthrough next gen evolution in DLT, it is just a shitcoin with a single attribute gimmick and a team that is either trying to pump and dump or too technically or tradfi system illiterate to know this.

61904573
>>61904499
Are you trying to pretend xrp is decentralized? Lol nigga you cant even explore the genesis block. Xrp is the ultimate centralized scamcoin if you wanna talk shit on other coins for being centralized

61904579
>>61904504
Keeta 11M TPS was a synthetic Google Cloud stress test. They are not Google partnered. Lol Eric Schmidt led a raise of like 20 million. Keeta didn't literally buy a bank and no other banks are coming. They have not closed on the bank. Ripple on the other hand have a national bank charter and are pending approval for a Fed master account they are likely to get at least a skinny version of with the Fed having dropped the reputation policy a few days ago, and have 300 bank partners already and are partnered with PSPs connecting tens of thousands of banks and billions of individual wallets. They have the prime brokerage that settles trillions per year, custody for majority top banks, are on the White House's reference board through the CFTC, are partnered with multiple Fednow core service providers (Finastra, Volante, etc.) a handful of which RUN XRP NODES, they are a platinum member of the American Bankers Association. They are also a member of the Federal Reserve's Faster Payments Task Force (only crypto company), the Bank for International Settlements' Crossborder Payments Interoperability and Extension Taskforce (only crypto company), the International Monetary Fund's High Level Advisory Group on Fintech, an ISDA (International Swaps and Derivatives Association) member (only public token promoting company), the ISO 20022 Registration Management Group (only crypto company, responsible for developing and overseeing the entire new financial messaging standard in the ISO 20022 messaging era), the Faster Payments Council ((industry standards and process governing body, only non-stablecoin crypto company-just look who their other members are, the Digital Dollar Project, the Digital Pound Foundation, the Digital Euro Association (only crypto company that is a member of all three), the Digital Chamber of Commerce, the only non-stablecoin crypto company on their High Level Advisory Group on Fintech. This is just a handful of stuff, could literally go on for pages.

61904584
>>61904573
XRP IS decentralized. The genesis block is irrelevant to XRP's consensus. You literally just know 10% of how bitcoin (WHICH HAD A FULL CHAIN REORG) works and think this is how all DLTs work. Because the bitcoin community was nuked by normies. It was designed to be a p2p payment system. Satoshi NEVER talked about the "store of value," it was supposed to be an open medium of exchange. Bitcoin pumped and was subverted by glowniggers and late normies who turned it into a greed cult of people who don't understand their own technology they are obsessed with the success of for greed they pretend to be principle and it is built to be trojan horse centralization that sells itself on L1 principles but literally requires shitty turbo-centralized L2s to be 1/100th as fast or cost efficient. It is also obviously less of an opportunity because the juice is already so squeezed. Same for eth largely, which got the regulatory free pass and corporatist carry that will come back to bite it because Nerayofff is a hero and they tried to throw him in prison but he is an autist and BTFO'd multiple government agencies having the judge declare them as acting in bad faith and he is exposing it all.

61904587
>>61904510
Is Keeta Sharia compliant?

61904903
How are the remaining tokens being unlocked and when? Is there a schedule? Do people mine it? And please post hand, if you aren’t white don’t even bother replying

61904907
you notice how one wall posting fidget always comes to the rescue kek

61905100
>>61904549
>>61904579
>>61904584

Redditors ruined this board. Bringing their shitty Cardano and XRP bags we dumped in them years ago. They will never buy anything good early. No pattern recognisation just appeals to government apparatus like the children they are.

61905103
>>61905100
>dumped in them
*blush*

61905133

61905186

so what, some AWS with ridiculous hardware?

61905203

61905204

61905214

>Just ask Nano, which catastrophically failed leading to all the operators abandoning it and the founders and team opportunistically using the moment to exit scam with the exchange that blocked withdrawal or sale while both publicly messaged that everything was fine and dumped.

Now explain why nano is still running today with 0 fees and faster speeds (much better than XRP)

Delusional cuckold

item.title: $SEV - Aptera. Electric car you never have to plug in — 42 replies — 10.9/hr
item.content:encoded:
$SEV - Aptera. Electric car you never have to plug in

Open thread • Replies: 42 • Updated: 2026-02-26 10:01 UTC

OP

This is a risky startup company, but FINALLY this year they are shipping their product. This summer, in fact. They just finished a final round of dilution a month ago, and the stock just hit a critical point where it’s actively in recovery.

It’s a real car, a product that *will* ship that nerds are geeking out about, and it appears now someone big is starting to slowly acquire it.

The first model will have its flaws, but it’s an electric car that can run off the solar panels on its roof. No one has ever done that before.

And the entire fucking company’s marketcap, this Nasdaq company, is $70 million.

You’re welcome.

(Disclosure: I obviously own some moderate sized bags of this, as should you)

Early replies (first 3)

61902124
Go look the shit up on YouTube and do some research. Tech bros will buy out the first line of these as fun geek toys, and by the second and third iterations, it’s gonna start getting serious. The big boys (aka Tesla) cannot afford to let this company get too large under their toes. They’ll acquire the stock and buy them out before that happen. That’s my thesis, anyway. The company’s not perfect, it has issues. But it’s worth more than $70 million for damn sure.

61902143
>>61902111

61902369
>>61902342
Look, solar powered cars are not a new idea. It's been floating around since the seventies. I remember asking myself why these didn't exist back in middle school. Unless photovoltaics become radically more efficient in a short amount of time, this startup just isn't going to take off.

61902391
>>61902369
Well they didn’t exist back in middle school because literally the solar cells weren’t good enough or affordable enough to do so.

But now they are - to the tune of 40 miles of driving a day. That’s significant. Is it perfect? No. But it’s something. I don’t commute or work a day job and I probably drive 40 miles or less a day. And there’s a certain sense of adventure in knowing I could drive this thing into the heart of Death Valley and not worry about getting stuck. You’ve never been able to do that before - especially with an electric.

Bitcoin was a clunky imperfect mess as well when it launched in 2009. But it was new, different, and allowed humans to do things they could never do before.

I think a car company that can do that is worth more than two bucks a share. That’s all I’m saying, and that’s why I put money into it. If you disagree, please return (with my blessing) to losing money on Tourette INU Sonic Trump Coin Gold or whatever the fuck shitters people are throwing around these days. But in 2026 we don’t get a lot of cracks at sub-$100M companies with novel tech and a product that’s about to ship. You just don’t. This is one such chance - for better or worse
